question.title: How to inherit an object from Java Agent in Java Code library in HCL Domino
question.body:
To maintain the code in an application I want to concentrate similar code of 2 Java agents in a Java code library. But I have some objects that are set in the Java agent (in the NotesMain section) and will also be used in some methods in the code library. How can I enable that the object in the Script library will have the value from the Agent?

e.g. in the Agent I set the database object:

public Database db        = null;
AgentContext agentContext = session.getAgentContext();
db                        = agentContext.getCurrentDatabase();

and in the code library I have a method to collect values from a profile document e.g.:

public HashMap<String, HashMap<String, String>> collectProfileValues(HashMap<String, HashMap<String, String>> mapCategories) {
  try {         
    Document profileDoc = db.getProfileDocument("profile",null);
    //...
  }

The agentcontext is not available in a scriptlibrary but somehow I want to transfer the database object from the agent to the code library without having to write code to establish a database object in the script library.

Can someone explain me how to set up this?

answers.body:
I think the preferred name is Java Code Library :-)

You can pass Notes objects (like NotesDatabase, NotesDocument, etc.) between agent and library as method parameters, as long as you do so explicitly e.g. :

java code lib:

package com.acme.utils; 

import lotus.domino.*;

public class DbHelper {
    
    public static void printDatabaseInfo(NotesDatabase db) throws NotesException {
        System.out.println("Database Title: " + db.getTitle());
        System.out.println("Path: " + db.getFilePath());
        System.out.println("Server: " + db.getServer());
    }

    public static Document createDoc(NotesDatabase db, String formName) throws NotesException {
        Document doc = db.createDocument();
        doc.replaceItemValue("Form", formName);
        return doc;
    }
}

and agent:

import lotus.domino.*;
import com.acme.utils.DbHelper;

public class JavaAgent extends AgentBase {

    public void NotesMain() {
        try {
            Session session = getSession();
            Database db = session.getCurrentDatabase();
            
            // Pass NotesDatabase object to library method
            DbHelper.printDatabaseInfo(db);

            Document doc = DbHelper.createDoc(db, "TestForm");
            doc.replaceItemValue("Subject", "Created via Java Library");
            doc.save(true, false);
            
        } catch (Exception e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}

I hope this helps.

79803032.body: Thank you so much. I have it working now!
